Defines roles and responsibilities
The process of identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks
A continuous process in cybersecurity
Helps organizations make better decisions
A weakness in a system or software
Can be exploited by a threat actor
A flaw or a bug
Software or code that takes advantage of a vulnerability
The tool used to carry out an attack
A common term in hacking
The malicious code that is delivered by an exploit
The part of the malware that does the damage
The 'what' of the attack
A small piece of code used to gain control of a system
Often used in buffer overflow attacks
A type of payload
Malware designed to gain root-level access
Hides its presence from the operating system
Can be very difficult to detect
A secret way to bypass security controls
A hidden entry to a system
Can be left by a developer or an attacker
A network of compromised computers
Controlled by a single command-and-control server
Used to launch DDoS attacks and other cybercrimes
